techs.name: Sailing
techs.quote: He who commands the sea has command of everything.

techs.name: Redomestication
techs.quote: Be fruitful, and multiply, and replenish the earth, and subdue it: and have dominion over the fish of the sea, and over the fowl of the air, and over every living thing that moveth upon the earth.

techs.name: Secrets of the Past
techs.quote: And the apostates cried, abandon your works, lest all the world be swallowed by the deluge. And many indeed came to follow them. Fools they were to defy the Spark! For did He not promise to never again drown the land? And, in punishment for their hubris, He sent the great flood of fire; and the unbelievers were turned to dust.

techs.name: Iron Working
techs.quote: I know not with what weapons World War III will be fought, but World War IV will be fought with sticks and stones.

techs.name: Construction
techs.quote: How happy are those whose walls already rise!

techs.name: Writing
techs.quote: And the things which shall be written out of the book shall be of great worth unto the children of men...

techs.name: Machinery
techs.quote: The press is the best instrument for enlightening the mind of man, and improving him as a rational, moral and social being.

techs.name: Mining
techs.quote: The meek shall inherit the Earth, but not its mineral rights.

techs.name: Trade
techs.quote: I know that all of us here have earned our places beyond doubt. But we are not safe, even here, and we cannot afford to stand still. I need your support today. I was appointed to this position not to sit behind a desk, but to fix problems, and that is what I intend to do...

techs.name: Astronomy
uniques: Enables [Embarked] units to enter ocean tiles
techs.quote: He made an instrument to know if the moon shine at full or no.

techs.name: Botany
techs.quote: Be at peace in the knowledge that all the neoliberals will die with the biosphere.

techs.name: Chemistry
techs.quote: For the days of my life have vanished like smoke, and my bones are grown dry like fuel for the fire.
uniques: Enables conversion of city production to gold

techs.name: Engineering
techs.quote: History doesn't repeat itself but it often rhymes.

techs.name: Education
techs.quote: Hereby it is manifest that during the time men live without a common Power to keep them all in awe, they are in that condition which is called War; and such a war as is of every man against every man.

techs.name: Steel
techs.quote: The old men are all dead. It is the young men who say yes or no.

techs.name: Currency
techs.quote: The ancient emporer Covfefe had such a fortune of pure water, he would wash his toilet with it.

techs.name: Oceanography
techs.quote: Why did the old Persians hold the sea holy? Why did the Greeks give it a separate deity, and own brother of Jove? Surely all this is not without meaning.

techs.name: Ecology
techs.quote: Modern industrial farming is largely a strategy for turning fossil fuels into food.

techs.name: Biology
techs.quote: If the brain were so simple we could understand it, we would be so simple we couldn't.

techs.name: Steam Power
techs.quote: Is it a fact - or have I dreamt it - that, by means of electricity, the world of matter has become a great nerve, vibrating thousands of miles in a breathless point of time?

techs.name: Civil Service
techs.quote: They are casting their problems on society. And, you know, there is no such thing as society.

techs.name: Decontamination
techs.quote: A society grows great when old men plant trees under whose shade they will never sit.

techs.name: Refrigeration
techs.quote: And homeless near a thousand homes I stood, and near a thousand tables pined and wanted food.

techs.name: Manufacturing
techs.quote: Manufacturing based on machinery, already referred to as a characteristic of our age, is but one aspect of the revolution that is being wrought by technology.

techs.name: Rifling
techs.quote: There is no struggle for life but, rather, life is lived for struggle. Thus, pacifism is trafficking with the enemy.

techs.name: Radio
techs.quote: Has the last word been said? Must hope disappear? Is defeat final? No! Believe me, I speak to you with full knowledge of the facts and tell you that nothing is lost.

techs.name: Desalination
techs.quote:
Record the start and finish times of the lights and appliances when you are finished in your logbook. If your role involves access to running water, you must record the meter readings before and after use. Failure to do so will lead to disciplinary action.

Remember -
EVERY DROP COSTS

techs.name: Laboratory
uniques: Enables conversion of city production to science
techs.quote: There is a plague on Man: his opinion that he knows something.

techs.name: Electronics
Replaceable Parts
techs.quote: Nothing is particularly hard if you divide it into small jobs.

techs.name: Munitions
techs.quote: As soon as men decide that all means are permitted to fight an evil, then their good becomes indistinguishable from the evil that they set out to destroy.

techs.name: Railroads
techs.quote: Iron and heat are, as we know, the supporters, the bases, of the mechanic arts.

techs.name: Hydroponics
techs.quote:
Thank you. I assure you, I am well aware of the contents of the latest report.

What choice is it you think we have? The time for caution is long past. We can only work with the greatest urgency in the hope that we may realize a technological solution. Anything less can lead only to failure, my friends.

techs.name: Plastics
techs.quote: Ben, I want to say one word to you, just one word: plastics.

techs.name: Flight
techs.quote: Aeronautics was neither an industry nor a science. It was a miracle.

techs.name: Ballistics
techs.quote:
Our goal is not the victory of might, but the vindication of right; not peace at the expense of freedom, but both peace and freedom, here in this hemisphere, and, we hope, around the world.

God willing, that goal will be achieved.

techs.name: Land Remediation
techs.quote: The nation that destroys its soil destroys itself.

techs.name: Computers
techs.quote: This has been a challenging quarter with falls in demand from states and agencies. Blackwarden Associates has recalibrated its operations across geographies, moving away from security and relief operations in Asia and divesting from the radiological remediation sector. By focusing on core domestic operations for private sector clients, we have successfully generated free cashflows despite adverse market conditions.

techs.name: Gyroscopes
techs.quote:
Things may be the same again; and we must fight
Not in the hope of winning but rather of keeping
Something alive: so that when we meet our end,
It may be said that we tackled wherever we could,
That battle-fit we lived, and though defeated,
Not without glory fought.

techs.name: Combined Arms
techs.quote: The root of the evil is not the construction of new, more dreadful weapons. It is the spirit of conquest.

techs.name: Radar
techs.quote: Vision is the art of seeing things invisible.

techs.name: Networking
techs.quote: In a real sense, the empires of old collapsed under their own weight; vast hierarchies of bureacrats, functionaries with no function, leaders without legitimacy. They could not adapt, not even to save themselves. From their ashes, we are building a new State; lean, strong, and vital.

techs.name: Avionics
techs.quote: In the end, that?™s what this election is about. Do we participate in a politics of cynicism, or do we participate in a politics of hope?

techs.name: Ocean Remediation
techs.quote: Only within the moment of time represented by the present century has one species, man, acquired significant power to alter the nature of his world.

techs.name: Decryption
techs.quote: The accounts are encrypted with a 1024-bit cipher. Even I can't break through the firewall.

techs.name: Rocketry
techs.quote: A good rule for rocket experimenters to follow is this: always assume that it will explode.

techs.name: Social Engineering
techs.quote: Anyone who believes exponential growth can go on forever in a finite world is either a madman or an economist.

techs.name: Genetics
techs.quote:
Each of the original messages contains a silver of wisdom, and whenever they seem to say different or incompatible things it is only because all are alluding, allegorically, to the same primeval truth.
 
As a consequence, there can be no advancement of learning. Truth has been already spelled out once and for all, and we can only keep interpreting its obscure message...

techs.name: Pharmaceuticals
techs.quote: In nothing do men more nearly approach the gods than in giving health to men.

techs.name: Nuclear Fission
techs.quote: I am become Death, the destroyer of worlds.

techs.name: Lasers
techs.quote: The night is far spent, the day is at hand: let us therefore cast off the works of darkness, and let us put on the armor of light.

techs.name: Human Genome
techs.quote: Humanity should study the foundations of heredity. But this will be possible only when science is liberated from superstition and limitation.

techs.name: Plastics Recycling
techs.quote: ... Could be the only reason the earth allowed us to be spawned from it in the first place. It wanted plastic for itself. Didn?™t know how to make it. Needed us.

techs.name: Advanced Materials
techs.quote: Bunkers were spaces of exception, where democratic states could morph into autocracies in times of war by making the decision to sacrifice the polis from this space of protection.

techs.name: Incentivization
techs.quote:
This is where we are tonight, everybody under surveillance by a satellite
You can be the first one on your block to die

techs.name: Particle Physics
techs.quote: Every particle of matter is attracted by or gravitates to every other particle of matter with a force inversely proportional to the squares of their distances.

techs.name: Energy Weapons
techs.quote: I believe that man will not merely endure: he will prevail. He is immortal, not because he alone among creatures has an inexhaustible voice, but because he has a soul, a spirit capable of compassion and sacrifice and endurance.

techs.name: Robotics
techs.quote: 1. A robot may not injure a human being or, through inaction, allow a human being to come to harm. 2. A robot must obey any orders given to it by human beings, except when such orders would conflict with the First Law. 3. A robot must protect its own existence as long as such protection does not conflict with the First or Second Law.

techs.name: Atmosphere Remediation
techs.quote: All analysed pathways limiting warming to 1.5Â°C with no or limited overshoot use CO2 removal to some extent to neutralize emissions.

techs.name: Nanotechnology
techs.quote: 'The impact of nanotechnology is expected to exceed the impact that the electronics revolution has had on our lives.' - Richard Schwartz

techs.name: Artificial Intelligence
techs.quote: This is only a foretaste of what is to come, and only the shadow of what is going to be.

techs.name: Future Materials
techs.quote: You ask, what is our aim? I can answer in one word. It is victory. Victory at all costs - Victory in spite of all terrors - Victory, however long and hard the road may be, for without victory there is no survival.

techs.name: Geo Engineering
techs.quote: It always seems impossible until it's done.

techs.name: Future Power
techs.quote: All the towers of ivory are crumbling, and the swallows have sharpened their beaks...

techs.name: Globalization
techs.quote: The new electronic interdependence recreates the world in the image of a global village.

techs.name: Future Tech
uniques: Who knows what the future holds?
techs.quote: I think we agree, the past is over.
